subject: Programming
title: Dijkstra's Shortest Path
description: A micro-lesson that makes Dijkstra's Shortest Path usable.

hook.text: Edsger Dijkstra designed his famous algorithm in 20 minutes while sitting at a cafÃ©.

buildup.text: His algorithm finds the shortest path between nodes in a weighted graph.

discovery.text: It greedily picks the closest unvisited node, updates its neighbors, and repeats.

twist.text: It fails with negative edge weights. If a shortcut costs less than zero, Dijkstra gets confused.

climax.text: Every GPS navigation app uses a descendant of Dijkstra's 1956 cafÃ© sketch.

punchline.text: A 20-minute sketch now routes billions of trips.
